intro: Chnoophora lanuginosa, commonly known as the woolly chnoophora, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its soft, woolly foliage, which gives it its common name. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Chnoophora lanuginosa produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
